newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's AIDC plans to sell part Optus.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's AIDC plans to sell part Optus.

text.p: Australia's government-owned investment company AIDC Ltd said on Thursday it was likely to sell some of its interest in Optus Communications, Australia's second largest telecommunications group, after Optus listed later this year.
"We have made no firm decisions on the Optus stake," AIDC managing director Chris Skilton told reporters.
"But we are likely to sell some on listing," Skilton said.
He said that AIDC did not know the conditions of the float such as the price but believed a float was planned for about November this year.
AIDC owns 25 million Optus shares. Optus is a rival to the state-owned Telstra Corp Ltd in the provision of local and long distance calls, and the mobile phone market.
The AIDC stake in Optus represents about 9.6 percent.
the bulk of the shares to be offered in Optus will come from healthcare and transport group Mayne Nickless Ltd which plans to sell its 25 percent stake.
With an issue of 600 million to 800 million shares, other stock would represent new shares and some sales by institutions, Optus said last month.
Optus is 24.5 percent owned by BellSouth Corp and Cable and Wireless Plc, with neither company planning to dilute its stake. The AMP Society has a 10.3 percent holding.
